column4: U.S. SEC files suit over possible insider trading on Bioverativ
column5: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed an insider trading lawsuit on Friday against "unknown traders" who it said engaged in "highly suspicious trading" just ahead of the announcement that hemophilia specialist Bioverativ Inc had agreed to be acquired by France's Sanofi in an $11.6 billion deal.

column4: U.S. SEC files suit over possible insider trading on Bioverativ
column5: Jan 26 The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filed an insider trading lawsuit on Friday against "unknown traders" who it said engaged in "highly suspicious trading" just ahead of the announcement that hemophilia specialist Bioverativ Inc had agreed to be acquired by France's Sanofi in an $11.6 billion deal.

column4: China's securities watchdog fines blogger over $31 000 for inaccurate information
column5: BEIJING  Jan 27 China's top securities watchdog said it had fined a blogger 200 000 yuan ($31 650) for producing and spreading information that was inaccurate and market-disturbing  the harshest penalty for such behaviour.

column4: UPDATE 4-Wynn resigns as RNC finance chair after sexual misconduct allegations
column5: WASHINGTON  Jan 27 Las Vegas casino mogul Steve Wynn resigned as finance chairman of the Republican Party's fundraising arm on Saturday  a day after a newspaper reported that he routinely subjected women who worked for him to unwanted sexual advances.

column4: Wynn Resorts CEO calls sexual misconduct accusations 'preposterous'; stock falls
column5: Las Vegas casino mogul Steve Wynn has routinely subjected women who work for him to unwanted sexual advances in a pattern of misconduct detailed by dozens of past and present employees  the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday  but the billionaire denied the accusations as "preposterous." | Video

column4: UPDATE 5-Wynn Resorts CEO calls sexual misconduct accusations 'preposterous'; stock falls
column5: Jan 26 Las Vegas casino mogul Steve Wynn has routinely subjected women who work for him to unwanted sexual advances in a pattern of misconduct detailed by dozens of past and present employees  the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday  but the billionaire denied the accusations as "preposterous."

column4: Wynn Resorts board opens inquiry into sexual misconduct accusations against chairman
column5: The Wynn Resorts Ltd  board of directors formed a special committee on Friday to investigate sexual misconduct allegations reported in the Wall Street Journal against the company's chairman and CEO  Steve Wynn  the board said in a statement.

column4: Wynn Resorts board opens inquiry into sexual misconduct accusations against chairman
column5: Jan 26 The Wynn Resorts Ltd board of directors formed a special committee on Friday to investigate sexual misconduct allegations reported in the Wall Street Journal against the company's chairman and CEO  Steve Wynn  the board said in a statement.

column4: WYNN RESORTS FORMS SPECIAL COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE SEXUAL MISCONDUCT ALLEGATIONS REPORTED IN WSJ AGAINST CHAIRMAN AND CEO STEVE WYNN -BOARD STATEMENT

column4: AbbVie wins U.S. trial in lawsuit over AndroGel's risks
column5: A federal jury in Chicago on Friday found AbbVie Inc  not liable in a lawsuit by an Arizona man who claimed he had suffered a pulmonary embolism due to using the company's testosterone replacement medication AndroGel.

column4: Airbus says Alabama plans at full throttle after CSeries verdict
column5: DUBLIN The head of Europe's Airbus pledged on Friday to push ahead at "full throttle" with plans for a new assembly line in Alabama for Bombardier Inc's CSeries jet  following what he called a "hands down" legal win for Airbus' Canadian partner against Boeing Co .

column4: U.S. trade body backs Canadian plane maker Bombardier against Boeing
column5: MONTREAL/WASHINGTON A U.S. trade commission on Friday handed an unexpected victory to Bombardier Inc against Boeing Co  in a ruling that allows the Canadian company to sell its newest jets to U.S. airlines without heavy duties  sending Bombardier's shares up 15 percent. | Video

column4: U.S. commerce chief hails 'robust' system after Bombardier decision
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Friday a decision by the U.S. International Trade Commission dismissing a trade complaint by Boeing Co against Canada's Bombardier Inc "shows how robust our system of checks and balances is.”

column4: U.S. trade body backs Canadian plane maker Bombardier against Boeing

column4: UPDATE 1-Deutsche Bank to hike bonuses to more than 1 bln euros for 2017 - FAS
column5: * Asset management flotation may come in March/April - source (Adds fund manager comment  source on asset management flotation)

column4: Deutsche Bank to hike bonuses to more than 1 bln euros for 2017 - FAS
column5: FRANKFURT  Jan 27 Deutsche Bank will hike annual bonus payments to more than 1 billion euros ($1.2 billion) despite posting its third consecutive annual loss in 2017  a German newspaper reported.

column4: U.S. CFTC to fine UBS  Deutsche Bank  HSBC for spoofing  manipulation: sources
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. derivatives regulator is set to announce it has fined European lenders UBS  HSBC and Deutsche Bank millions of dollars each for so-called "spoofing" and manipulation in the U.S. futures market  three people with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

column4: ATM maker warns of possible 'jackpotting' hacks on U.S. machines
column5: Jan 27 ATM maker Diebold Nixdorf Inc warned banks that hackers may be targeting U.S. cash machines with tools that force them to spit out cash  the latest development to highlight the increasing threat hackers pose to financial firms.

column4: Exclusive: Detained Saudi billionaire Alwaleed confident his troubles will end soon
column5: RIYADH Saudi Arabian billionaire Prince Alwaleed bin Talal  detained in the kingdom's sweeping crackdown on corruption  said on Saturday that he expected to be cleared of any wrongdoing and released from custody within days  with his vast assets intact.
